intro: Riddellia tagetina, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Riddellia tagetina is often found in disturbed areas and can be invasive in certain regions.
